intro: Bellardia trixago f. stricta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bellardia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, exhibiting a low, sprawling growth habit. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters. This variety is distinguished by its more compact form compared to the typical form of Bellardia trixago.
